intro: Indigofera himachalensis, commonly known as the Himachal indigofera, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, temperate forests at high altitudes. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces pods containing small, hard seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
